edge: Jaani Dushman: Ek Anokhi Kahaani is a Hindi-language fantasy action thriller film directed and produced by Rajkumar Kohli.
Jaani Dushman: Ek Anokhi Kahaani is a 2002 Indian Hindi-language fantasy action thriller film directed and produced by Rajkumar Kohli,
Jaani Dushman: Ek Anokhi Kahaani is a 2002 Indian Hindi-language fantasy action thriller film directed and produced by Rajkumar Kohli,
Jaani Dushman: Ek Anokhi Kahaani was Armaan Kohli's comeback film where he was reintroduced with a new name Munish Kohli,
Though they had no scenes together, Jaani Dushman: Ek Anokhi Kahaani marked the first film featuring both Akshay Kumar and Sunny Deol,
Though they had no scenes together, Jaani Dushman: Ek Anokhi Kahaani marked the first film featuring both Akshay Kumar and Sunny Deol, two major action stars of the previous decade,
They are the main antagonists in Jaani Dushman: Ek Anokhi Kahaani,
Over the years, Jaani Dushman achieved cult status in the 'so bad it's good' genre due to frequent television re-runs.

node_2: widely regarded as one of the worst ever made
edge: Jaani Dushman is widely regarded as one of the worst ever made.
Upon its release, the film received overwhelmingly negative reviews
Jaani Dushman was a box office failure.
Critics cited a poorly executed story,
Critics cited illogical scenes,
Critics cited miscasting,
The use of older actors as college students,
Following its failure, singer Sonu Nigam, who debuted as an actor in the film, was poorly received.
The careers of actresses Rambha, Kiran Rathod, Pinky Campbell, and actor Siddharth Ray also ended with this film.
Following its failure, director Rajkummar Kohli retired from filmmaking.

Divya's ghost is summoned by Atul and his friends, but Atul initially doesn't believe their innocence when she accuses them of calling her to the fort after she declined. Later, Atul realizes he survived an attack because of a necklace given by the principal that provides protection from supernatural forces.
Divya's ghost enters Prem's friend Kapil and impersonates Nita, which leads to Kapil badly injuring Atul but failing to kill him.
Divya enters Prem's body and kills his nemesis, Ashok.
Rashmi is willing to give a false statement because she was also in love with Prem, which helps set Prem free from being accused of murder.
Kapil shapeshifts into Rashmi and accuses Prem of the murder in court, leading to his wrongful conviction and death sentence.
Preeti's father wants her to marry Raju instead of Vijay because he is his friend's boxer son.
Raju colludes with Preeti's father to kill Vijay in a boxing match to remove him from the picture.
Divya enters Raju's body and almost knocks out Vijay, but the principal notices this and uses his paraphernalia to block Divya's presence.
Divya doesn't let Kapil interfere with her plan of killing Vijay.
Preeti informs Vijay of his friends' deaths, which scares Vivek.
Karan returns to Mumbai to protect Vijay after hearing about the death of all his friends.
Before Karan could arrive home, Kapil impersonates their college principal and tries to kill him.
Kapil then impersonates Vivek and stabs him, but couldn't kill him after noticing Karan's arrival.
Atul comes out of a coma and escapes the hospital with Vivek, who also recovered at the same hospital.
Kapil then goes after Atul.
Atul, unable to destroy Kapil or save Vivek's life, goes to the principal and begs him to save Vivek's life.
A confused Karan is arrested after Vivek accuses him of the stabbing.
Atul then dies due to blood loss from his injuries.

The negative critical reception led to a drastic fall in the box office collection of Jaani Dushman: Ek Anokhi Kahani, resulting in the film being declared a 'Flop' by Box Office India.
The collection of Jaani Dushman: Ek Anokhi Kahani continued declining and finally ended up at a domestic net of ₹107.1 million.
The first-week collection closed at ₹64.7 million for Jaani Dushman: Ek Anokhi Kahani.
The music for Jaani Dushman: Ek Anokhi Kahani was composed by Anand Raj Anand & Anand–Milind.
The music for Jaani Dushman: Ek Anokhi Kahani was released on Universal Music.
All tracks composed by Anand–Milind had lyrics penned by Sameer.
The music for Jaani Dushman: Ek Anokhi Kahani had a guest composition by Sandeep Chowta.
The tracks composed by Anand Raj Anand had lyrics written by Dev Kohli for Jaani Dushman: Ek Anokhi Kahani.
